title: Anglesey Coastal Path Highlights
tagline: The best sections of the 125-mile loop
suitableFor: Active individuals and couples who enjoy coastal walking, wildlife spotting, and historical sites. A reasonable level of fitness is needed for the hikes.
notSuitableFor: Those with limited mobility or those seeking purely relaxing beach holidays. Very young children may find the hiking too challenging.

stops.title: South Stack Cliffs Walk
stops.description: Explore the dramatic cliffs of South Stack, enjoying stunning views and spotting seabirds like puffins and guillemots.

wetAlt.title: RSPB South Stack Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Learn about the wildlife of South Stack and enjoy indoor exhibits.

budgetAlt.title: Free Birdwatching
budgetAlt.description: Bring binoculars and enjoy birdwatching from the cliff tops without entering the paid reserve.

stops.title: The Sea Shanty Cafe
stops.description: A cosy cafe near South Stack, serving sandwiches, soups, and cakes with sea views.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at South Stack viewpoint
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own sandwiches with panoramic views.

stops.title: Trearddur Bay Beach & Optional Coasteering
stops.description: Relax on the sandy beach at Trearddur Bay, or for the adventurous, try a coasteering session.

wetAlt.title: Trearddur Bay Hotel Spa
wetAlt.description: Relax indoors with a spa treatment at the Trearddur Bay Hotel.

budgetAlt.title: Free beach walk and rock pooling
budgetAlt.description: Explore the coastline at your own pace.

stops.title: Trearddur Bay Hotel
stops.description: A comfortable hotel with sea views, perfect for relaxing after a day of exploring the coast.

budgetAlt.title: Camping at Newborough Forest Campsite
budgetAlt.description: Pitch your tent amidst the trees for a budget-friendly overnight stay.

stops.title: Newborough Forest and Llanddwyn Island Walk
stops.description: Explore Newborough Forest, leading to the beautiful Llanddwyn Island with its iconic lighthouse and stunning views.

wetAlt.title: Plas Newydd House and Garden (National Trust)
wetAlt.description: Visit this historic house with beautiful gardens overlooking the Menai Strait.

budgetAlt.title: Free Walk through Newborough Forest
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a free stroll through the forest and along Newborough Beach.

stops.title: The Pilot House Cafe
stops.description: A charming cafe in Pilot House with a great view of the beach.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic on Llanddwyn Beach
budgetAlt.description: Pack your own lunch and enjoy it with stunning sea views.

stops.title: Menai Bridge RIB Ride
stops.description: Experience the thrill of a high-speed RIB ride along the Menai Strait, passing under the iconic bridges.

wetAlt.title: Visit Beaumaris Castle
wetAlt.description: Explore this impressive medieval castle, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

budgetAlt.title: Walk across the Menai Bridge
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy stunning views of the Menai Strait on foot.

stops.title: Plas Menai Accommodation
stops.description: Stay in the activity centre. Close to Menai Bridge and with a range of water sports on offer.

budgetAlt.title: Camping at Newborough Forest Campsite
budgetAlt.description: Pitch your tent amidst the trees for a budget-friendly overnight stay.

stops.title: Beaumaris Castle Exploration
stops.description: Discover the history and architecture of Beaumaris Castle, a magnificent unfinished fortress.

wetAlt.title: Beaumaris Gaol
wetAlt.description: Explore this well-preserved Victorian prison and learn about its grim history.

budgetAlt.title: Walk around the Beaumaris Castle exterior
budgetAlt.description: Appreciate the castle's grandeur from the outside without paying the entrance fee.

stops.title: The Red Boat Ice Cream Parlour
stops.description: Enjoy award-winning homemade ice cream with waterfront views in Beaumaris.
stops.travelToNext: 30 min drive to Red Wharf Bay

budgetAlt.title: Bring your own snack
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own packed snacks with waterfront views.

stops.title: Red Wharf Bay Beach Walk and Wildlife Spotting
stops.description: Take a leisurely stroll along the vast sands of Red Wharf Bay, known for its birdlife and shellfish.

wetAlt.title: Oriel Tegfryn Art Gallery
wetAlt.description: Browse contemporary Welsh art in this gallery near Menai Bridge.

budgetAlt.title: Relax on Red Wharf Bay Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the scenery, even on a cloudy day.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Anglesey weather can be unpredictable. Pack layers and be prepared for rain, even in summer. Coastal winds can be strong.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy during peak season (July/August), especially around Beaumaris and Menai Bridge. Allow extra time for travel. Parking at popular spots like South Stack and Newborough can fill up quickly, arrive early or consider using park-and-ride services if available.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Accommodation and some activities (e.g., RIB rides, coasteering) should be booked in advance, especially during peak season. Check opening times for attractions like Beaumaris Castle.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: The walks on this itinerary are moderately challenging, with some uneven terrain and inclines. A reasonable level of fitness is required.
